data.title: A Dark Wind Covers Arkham
data.text: Mythos Ability: The terror level increases by 1. The maximum Stamina of all investigators in Arkham is reduced by 1. Horror checks in Arkham are made at a -2 penalty.

data.title: A New Dawn!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator who is currently at 2 or less Sanity gains 1 Sanity. Each investigator who is currently at 2 or less Stamina gains 1 Stamina.

data.title: A Strange Plague
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators cannot gain Stamina except by receiving medical care in St. Mary's Hospital (or from Vincent Lee).

data.title: Aldeberan Ascendant
data.text: Mythos Ability: Flying creatures do not move to the sky. Gates to Another Dimension cannot be closed or sealed.

data.title: Alien Technology
data.text: Mythos Ability: Mi-Go have their toughness increased by 2. If an investigator passes a Combat check against a Mi-Go, he draws 1 extra Unique Item.

data.title: All Quiet in Arkham!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each player may pass a Luck (-1) check to be Blessed.

data.title: Along Came Jones
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first investigator who ends his movement in the Train Station draws 1 Ally, then discards this card from play.

data.title: Amnesiac Professor's Memory Returns!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Place 2 Clue tokens in each location with an elder sign.

data.title: An Evil Fog
data.text: Mythos Ability: Will checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. Fliers do not move.

data.title: Angry Red Skies
data.text: Mythos Ability: Will checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Lore checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. Fliers do not move to or from the Sky.

data.title: Another Time, Another Place!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Every open gate leading to Another Dimension or Another Time releases one monster into its location.

data.title: Balmy
data.text: Mythos Ability: Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Fight checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. When moving, stalkers move to investigators in street areas or unstable locations up to 2 spaces away.

data.title: Bank Foreclosure
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigators in Arkham with Bank Loans must pay them off immediately. You may sell items at half their list price (round down) if you do not have the $10; if you cannot or will not pay, you are arrested.

data.title: Bank Targeted By Grifters
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Place 1 Clue token on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it entered play).

data.title: Big Storm Sweeps Arkham!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Sky and Outskirts are returned to the cup.

data.title: Bizarre Couriers
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators in Arkham may immediately trade items or money without being in the same location. However, each investigator involved in the transaction loses 1 Sanity per item given or received.

data.title: Bizarre Dreams Plague Citizens!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Gugs and Nightgaunts in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

data.title: Black Sabbath!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Rat-things, Witches, and Warlocks in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

data.title: Blackest Night
data.text: Mythos Ability: Luck checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.

data.title: Blood Magic
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in Rivertown streets may choose to delve into dark mysteries using their life force. They roll dice equal to their current Stamina, and for every failed die, they lose 1 Stamina. If this reduces them to 0 Stamina, they are devoured and the player must start a new character. Otherwise, they gain 3 Clue tokens.

data.title: Blue Flu!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators in jail are released. No investigators may be arrested until the end of next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

data.title: Blue Plate Special
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in Velma's Diner may spend up to $4 instead of having an Arkham encounter. They gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity for every $1 spent.

data.title: Blue Skies
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Investigators receive -1 Sneak, +1 Speed.

data.title: Book Sale
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Library may spend $2 instead of having an Arkham encounter. Any investigator that does so then takes the first Tome from the Unique Items deck.

data.title: Brawling in the Streets
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator in a street area at the end of the Mythos phase must make a Fight (+0) check. If he fails and the terror level is 3 or less, he loses 1 Stamina. If he fails the check and the terror level is 4 or higher, he loses 2 Stamina.

data.title: Break-In at Neil's
data.text: Mythos Ability: The thieves carelessly break a dangerous artifact, releasing 2 monsters into the South Shore streets.

data.title: Brutal Accident!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player must choose one investigator (even himself). That investigator loses 3 Stamina.

data.title: Campus Security Increased!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Miskatonic U. Streets or Locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Cash on the Hoof!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player finds $2 lying on the ground.

name: Charity Auction!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Charity Auction!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Deal a number of cards from the top of the Common Item deck equal to the number of players. Each player may purchase one item at its listed cost plus $1. Discard any items not purchased.

data.title: Charity Case!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The investigator with the lowest Sanity (the first player breaks ties) may move to Arkham Asylum and be delayed to restore his Sanity to its maximum.

name: Checkered Cab Trials Begin!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Checkered Cab Trials Begin!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators in Arkham may move directly to any street location in Arkham as their entire move (ignore all monsters between their current location and their destination).

data.title: Church Boycotts Exhibit
data.text: Mythos Ability: Lore checks in Arkham are made at a -2 penalty. Will checks in Arkham are made at a +2 bonus.

data.title: Church Group Reclaims Southside!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Southside streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Citizens Urged to Lock Doors
data.text: Mythos Ability: Monsters appear in the Outskirts until the Outskirts limit is reached. If the Outskirts already contains the maximum number of monsters, return all of the monsters in the Outskirts to the monster cup and increase the terror level by 1.

data.title: City Gripped by Blackouts!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The General Store, Curiositie Shoppe, and Ye Olde Magick Shoppe are closed until the end of next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

data.title: Closed Mouths
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, Clue tokens do not appear on the board when mythos cards are resolved.

data.title: Clothing Drive
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, investigators without Exhibit Items must evade or fight a Mummy in each street location they enter. These Mummies have the same stats as Zombies except with a toughness of 2, and cannot be taken as trophies.

data.title: Compass Needles Point South!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player chooses two investigators. Those investigators immediately exchange locations, ignoring all monsters and movement restrictions.

name: Construction Crew Conundrum!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Construction Crew Conundrum!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster appears at the Downtown streets and the Miskatonic U. streets.

name: Contagion Kills Life in Blasted Heath!

data.title: Contagion Kills Life in Blasted Heath!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Blasted Heath streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Cops Sweep Kingsport!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in Kingsport street areas or locations are returned to the monster cup.

data.title: Corpse Garden
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Central Hill streets gain 2 Clue tokens, then lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.

data.title: Corpses Preserved
data.text: Mythos Ability: Monster trophies come to life! Each investigator in Arkham must randomly choose one of his collected monster trophies. That monster surprises him. If the investigator defeats the monster, he may draw cards from the Exhibit Item deck equal to its toughness, take one, and discard the rest. Only monsters that are defeated may be taken as trophies again; if the investigator flees or the monster defeats him, the monster is returned to the box.

data.title: Cosmic Upheaval!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators that are currently in Other Worlds must immediately pass a Luck (-1) check or be lost in time and space.

data.title: Couriers in Town!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Until the end of next turn, investigators may trade Items with one another without being in the same space. Leave this card in place to signify this. Items may only be traded in this manner during Upkeep.

data.title: Cover-up
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 3 Clue tokens per player on it. Any player may discard monster trophies while in the Downtown streets during the Arkham Encounters Phase to remove 1 Clue token from this card for each toughness worth of monsters discarded.

data.title: Curfew Enforced
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator who ends his movement in the streets must pass a Will (+0) check or be arrested and taken to the Police Station.

data.title: Cursed Relics
data.text: Mythos Ability: Place 5 doom tokens on this card when it comes into play.

data.title: Dark Conjunction
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, all monsters gain Overwhelming 1. Any monster that already has Overwhelming has its Overwhelming rating increased by 1.

data.title: Dark Day!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators cannot spend Clue tokens to add to skill checks until the end of next turn. Leave this card in play until then as a reminder.

data.title: Dark Shapes at Dusk!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Ghasts, Leng Spiders, and Moon-beasts are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

data.title: Dark Skies
data.text: Mythos Ability: Fight checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. Stalkers move like normal monsters.

data.title: Darke's Carnival Arrives
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Northside streets gain 1 Clue token from the sinister wonders they witness, but must pass a Will (-1) check or lose 1 Sanity.

data.title: Deathly Still
data.text: Mythos Ability: Will checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Fight checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. Monsters that move normally are stalkers.

data.title: Dire Portents Abound
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators receive -1 to checks to close Gates.

data.title: Disturbing the Dead
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Roll a die at the end of every Mythos Phase while this card is in play (beginning the turn after it entered play). On a 1 or 2, increase the terror level by 1.

data.title: Double the Trouble
data.text: Mythos Ability: Two Gates open this turn, but no doom tokens are added to the doom track.

data.title: Dreams of a Sunken City
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators cannot gain Sanity except by receiving psychiatric care at Arkham Asylum (or from Carolyn Fern).

data.title: Dunwich Villagers Drive Out Undesirables!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Village Commons streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Early Frost
data.text:
Mythos Ability: As they slip and fall on the ice, each investigator loses 1 Stamina for each movement point over 3 he spends each turn.
Reading Tomes does not count towards this total.

data.title: Eccentric Opens Doors
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the French Hill streets may discard 1 Gate trophy to draw 1 Unique Item

data.title: Eerie Coincidences
data.text: Mythos Ability: Two Gates open this turn, but no doom tokens are added to the doom track.

data.title: Egyptian Exhibit Visits Miskatonic U.
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator who ends his movement in the Miskatonic U. streets may pass a Lore (-1) check to gain 1 Clue token by reading the strange hieroglyphics on the artifacts in the exhibit.

name: Endlessly Breeding
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Endlessly Breeding
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: At the end of each Mythos phase, draw a second Mythos card and ignore everything on it except for its monster movement pattern. Each time an investigator is reduced to 0 Stamina or 0 Sanity, place a Clue token on this card.

data.title: Escape from Arkham Asylum!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Collect up to 3 Maniacs, drawing them first from the monster cup, then from the Outskirts, then from those claimed as trophies. Place them all in the Downtown streets.

data.title: Estate Sale
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Uptown streets may draw 2 Unique Items and purchase one, none, or both of them at list price, discarding any that are not purchased.

data.title: Evidence Destroyed!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A massive conspiracy sets back the investigation. Discard all Clue tokens from the board.

data.title: Family Found Butchered!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The terror level increases by 1 in light of this tragic news.

data.title: Feds Raid Arkham!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the streets are returned to the cup.

data.title: Fire at the Mill!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Until the end of the next turn, any time an investigator draws 1 or more Common Items for any reason, he draws 1 fewer cards (to a minimum of 0). Leave this card in play to indicate this.

name: Fires in the Night
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Fires in the Night
data.text: Mythos Ability: Monsters at the Woods do not move. Monsters in the Uptown streets who move move to the woods.

data.title: Footprints on Shore!
data.text: Mythos Ability: It seems that 2 monsters have come ashore in the Innsmouth Shore streets.

data.title: Forgery!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Until the end of next turn, any time an investigator draws 1 or more Unique Items for any reason, he draws 1 fewer cards (to a minimum of 0). Leave this card in play to indicate this.

data.title: Formal Dress Gala Announced!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator may choose to immediately spend $5 to gain 2 Sanity and 2 Clue tokens.

data.title: Fourth of July Parade!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators cannot move into or out of the Merchant Dist. streets until the end of next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

data.title: Free Clinic!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The investigator with the lowest Stamina (the first player breaks ties) may move to St. Mary's Hospital and be delayed to restore his Stamina to its maximum.

name: Full Moon
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Full Moon
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters have their Sanity damage increased by 1.

data.title: Fund Drive for the Arts
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators in Arkham may immediately spend up to $1 for every Ally left in the Ally deck. For every $2 an investigator spends, he may draw one card from the Unique Item deck. He then takes one card from among those he has drawn and shuffles the rest back into the deck.

name: Funnel Clouds
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Funnel Clouds
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator who ends his movement in the streets must pass a Luck (+1) check or be devoured.

data.title: Gangs Clean Up Easttown!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Easttown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Gathering Storm!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The situation in Innsmouth continues to worsen. Add one uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track.

data.title: Ghost Ship Docks by Itself!
data.text: Mythos Ability: An ancient ghost ship arrives in Arkham, releasing 2 monsters into the Merchant Dist. streets.

data.title: Goat-like Creature Spotted in Woods!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Dark Young in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

data.title: Good Traveling Conditions
data.text: Mythos Ability: Fight checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Speed checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus, and investigators receive 1 extra movement point. Monsters that move normally are fast.

data.title: Good Work Undone
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 6 Clue tokens on it. Any player may spend Clue tokens during the Arkham Encounter Phase while in the Easttown streets to discard Clue tokens from this card on a 1-for-1 basis.

data.title: Gossip Runs Wild!
data.text: Mythos Ability: If the Dunwich Horror is in play, increase the terror level by 2. Investigators can trade Clue tokens like other Items until the end of next turn. Leave this card in play until then to show this.

data.title: Graverobbers Strike!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Unfortunately for them, they release 2 monsters into the Central Hill streets.

name: Gypsy Caravan
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Gypsy Caravan
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Southside Streets may roll a die. On a success, they gain $2. On a failure, they lose $1.

data.title: Hallelujah!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first investigator who ends his movement in South Church is Blessed, then discards this card from play.

data.title: Happy Days are Here Again
data.text: Mythos Ability: Due to the renewed prosperity that has come to Arkham, the terror level cannot increase.

data.title: Heat Wave
data.text: Mythos Ability: Fight checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Lore checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. Fire Vampires have their toughness increased by 1.

data.title: Hellene Sighted!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The ancient ship briefly docks, releasing 2 monsters into the Harborside streets.

data.title: Help Wanted
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first investigator without a Retainer who ends his movement at the Newspaper gains a Retainer, then discards this card from play.

data.title: High Tides
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators in Rivertown, Easttown, and Merchant District streets or locations must pass a Fight (-1) Check or be delayed.

name: Horns of the Black Goat
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Horns of the Black Goat
data.text: Mythos Ability: Dark Young have their toughness increased by 1.

data.title: Horrifying Sight!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player must choose one investigator (even himself). That investigator loses 3 Sanity.

data.title: Horror at Groundbreaking!
data.text: Mythos Ability: An ancient stone is disturbed by the construction, releasing 2 monsters into the Miskatonic U. streets.

data.title: Hospital Patients Disappear!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators who have an Injury card (from the Dunwich Horror expansion) or whose Stamina is currently 2 or less move immediately to the first area of Another Dimension.

data.title: Icy Conditions
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators receive 1 less movement point during the Movement Phase. Fast Monsters move like normal monsters.

data.title: Ill Wind Grips Arkham!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player must pass a Luck (-1) check or be Cursed

data.title: Impassable Streets
data.text: Mythos Ability: An investigator may not move to a street area if there is a black movement arrow leading to it from his present street area. This does not effect moving from a location to a street area or from a street area to a location.

data.title: Infestation of Rats
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator in Ma's Boarding House or Velma's Diner at the end of the Mythos Phase, as well as each investigator in First National Grocery, Gilman House Hotel, or Innsmouth Jail on the Innsmouth Horror expansion game board at the end of the Mythos Phase, loses 1 Sanity.

data.title: Innsmouth Invasion!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The city of Innsmouth is suddenly crawling with monsters. A monster appears in the Church Green streets, the Innsmouth Shore streets, the Factory District streets, Sawbone Alley, and Devil Reef.

data.title: Innsmouth is Restless
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, investigators who end their movement in Innsmouth receive a -1 penalty to their Evade check to avoid being arrested once martial law is declared in Innsmouth.

data.title: Innsmouth Sleeps
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, investigators who end their movement in Innsmouth do not need to make the usual Evade check to avoid being arrested once martial law is declared in Innsmouth.

data.title: Intermission
data.text:
Mythos Ability: The town of Arkham collectively holds its breath as the terrible play "The King in Yellow" builds to a crescendo, preparing to reveal its darkest horrors.
But for the moment, nothing happens.  No gates open, but the terror level is increased by 2.

data.title: Jail Break!
data.text: Mythos Ability: However, it appears that whatever was being held in the jail wasn't quite human, so 2 monsters are released into the Church Green streets.

data.title: King of Cards Cancels Show
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Witches and Warlocks in Arkham are returned to the cup. If any investigator has Eric Weiss as an Ally, that investigator gains those monsters as trophies.

data.title: Kingsport Mists
data.text: Mythos Ability: Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. The Causeway, the Wireless Station, and the Strange High House in the Mists are closed while this card remains in play.

data.title: Lightning Storm
data.text: Mythos Ability: At the start of each Upkeep Phase while this card is in play, roll a die. On a 1 or 2, the first player must choose an investigator in a street area (if there are any). That investigator loses a die of Stamina and moves to St. Mary's Hospital.

name: Lightning Strikes Twice!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Lightning Strikes Twice!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Two similar rocks are shattered by lightning strikes in different parts of Arkham, each releasing a monster. A monster appears at the French Hill streets and the Uptown streets.

data.title: Local Heiress Missing!
data.text: Mythos Ability: If any player has Asenath Waite as an Ally, she is returned to the box and a doom token is added to the Ancient One's doom track.

data.title: Lodge Member Held for Questioning!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A Silver Lodge ritual lets 2 monsters loose in the French Hill streets.

data.title: Lodge Members Watch the Night!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the French Hill streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Lynch Mob!
data.text: Mythos Ability: One Ally is randomly drawn from the Ally deck and returned to the box.

data.title: Mad Bomber
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place $4 per player on it. Any player may pay money while in the Merchant District streets during the Arkham Encounters Phase to remove money from this card on a 1-for-1 basis.

data.title: Manhunt in Arkham!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Medical Supplies Contaminated
data.text: Mythos Ability: When an investigator pays $2 to use the "Medical Care" ability at St. Mary's Hospital, he loses 1 Sanity. When an investigator pays $2 to use the "Psychiatric Care" ability at Arkham Asylum, he loses 1 Stamina.

data.title: Merchants March on Crime!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Merchant Dist. streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Meteorite Spotted in Blasted Heath!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A crashed meteorite releases 2 monsters into the Blasted Heath streets.

data.title: Mirages of Lakes
data.text: Mythos Ability: When investigators move from one street to another, they may only move in the direction of the black arrows. Locations may be entered normally.

data.title: Miskatonic Arctic Expedition Returns!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any Elder Things previously claimed as monster trophies by players return to life and are placed in the River Docks.

data.title: Miskatonic Launches New Research Ship!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Place 2 Clue tokens in the River Docks, Unvisited Isle, as well as all aquatic locations and all aquatic street areas on expansion game boards.

data.title: Miskatonic Scientists Research Anomalies!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Place 2 Clue tokens in the Science Building as well as all street areas and locations adjacent to a vortex.

data.title: Missing People Return!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators currently lost in time and space immediately return to Arkham, appearing in a street or location of their choice.

data.title: Mistrust
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 3 Clue tokens per player on it. Any player may discard Common or Unique Items while in the Southside streets during the Arkham Encounters Phase to remove 1 Clue token per Common or 2 per Unique Item discarded.

data.title: Moon Creature Hoax
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player draws a monster marker from the cup at random and places it in the Sky. Treat this monster as a flying monster until it moves to a street area. After that, the monster's movement is treated normally.

data.title: Mudslides
data.text: Mythos Ability: During the Mythos Phase, each player whose investigator is in a street area must roll a die. If the result is a 1, the investigator must move to the street area that is reached by following the white arrow from his current street area. If the white arrow leads to a vortex or an area with a gate, the investigator stays in his current street area instead.

data.title: Murder in the Museum
data.text: Mythos Ability: Players in Arkham with gate trophies must make a Fight check or Lore check for each trophy they have, with a modifier equal to the modifier printed on the gate. If a check for a gate is failed, draw monsters from the cup until you draw a monster with a symbol that matches the one on the gate, and place that monster in the player's current location. If the check for a gate succeeds, the player may remove one monster with that gate's symbol from Arkham, the Outskirts, or the Sky.

name: Murderer at Large; Victims' Brains Missing

data.title: Murderer at Large; Victims' Brains Missing
data.text: Mythos Ability: The terror level increases by 1.

data.title: Museum Artifacts Stolen
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators in Arkham may pay $5 in bribe fees to make a connection with the robbers. Those who do so may draw a number of Exhibit Items equal to their focus, choose one, and discard the rest.

data.title: Museum Haunted
data.text: Mythos Ability: The ghosts of the pharaohs walk abroad! Collect up to 2 Ghosts, drawing them first from the monster cup, then from the Outskirts, then from those claimed as trophies. Place them in the Miskatonic U. streets. Investigators who destroy one of these Ghosts before the end of next turn may draw one Exhibit Item. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this. The terror level increases by 1.

name: Mysterious Crates Found Empty!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Mysterious Crates Found Empty!
data.text: Mythos Ability: But the monsters inside them have already escaped. A monster appears at the Riverside streets and the Northside streets.

data.title: Mysterious Lights Fade!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The investigators may collectively spend 5 Clue tokens. If they do so, the first player may choose and close 1 open Gate in any Arkham location and reshuffle it into the stack of Gate markers (he does not gain a Gate trophy). The investigators may not do this if there is only 1 open Gate.

data.title: Neighborhood Sale
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Easttown streets may draw 2 Common Items and purchase one, none, or both of them at list price, discarding any that are not purchased.

data.title: New Miskatonic U. Curriculum
data.text: Mythos Ability: If an investigator reads a Tome in the Library, he gains a +2 bonus to any Lore check made to do so.

data.title: New Moon
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators receive 1 less movement point (to a minimum of 0) during the Movement Phase. When an investigator is driven insane, he does not discard any of his Clue tokens.

data.title: Nightmare Pool
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 3 Sanity tokens per player on it. Any player may pay Sanity while in the Uptown streets during the Arkham Encounters Phase to remove Sanity tokens from this card on a one-for-one basis.

name: No One Can Help You Now

data.title: No One Can Help You Now
data.text: Mythos Ability: Gates cannot be sealed, although they can still be closed.

data.title: Noden's Favor
data.text: Mythos Ability: It costs 2 fewer Clue tokens to seal gates.

data.title: Noted Author Dies
data.text: Mythos Ability: All players must discard 1 Clue token.

data.title: Off Broadway
data.text: Mythos Ability: All purchases in Arkham cost $1 more than usual.

data.title: Old Building Collapses!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Unfortunately, the building was containing 2 monsters, which have now been released into the Factory District streets.

data.title: Old Debts Come Due!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Raise the terror level by 1. Any investigator who has previously made a deal with the Dark Man of Wizard's Hill is devoured. For every investigator devoured in this way, place 3 doom tokens on the doom track. All current debts to the Dark Man are now considered paid.

name: One Thousand Young
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: One Thousand Young
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: When a monster enters Uptown Streets, place it on this card. Monsters on this card do not count against the monster limit.

data.title: Oppressive Atmosphere
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, all monsters gain Nightmarish 1. Any monster that already has Nightmarish has its Nightmarish rating increased by 1.

data.title: Order of Dagon Suspected!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Although no proof exists, it is suspected that the Esoteric Order of Dagon released 2 monsters into the Church Green streets.

name: Parazoologist Visits Miskatonic U.
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Parazoologist Visits Miskatonic U.
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Miskatonic U. Streets may discard 5 Toughness worth of monster trophies to gain 1 Spell.

name: Patient Claims Madness Caused by Words!

data.title: Patient Claims Madness Caused by Words!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator with a Tome loses 2 Sanity. Each investigator who does not have a Tome, but does have 1 or more Spells, loses 1 Sanity.

name: Pets and Wildlife Mutilated!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Pets and Wildlife Mutilated!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Monsters must be on the prowl.  A monster appears in the Merchant District streets and the Southside streets.

data.title: Pickpocket Ring at Large!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator must make a Luck (-1) check. Any investigator that fails must either discard his most expensive item or lose all of his money.

data.title: Picnickers Panic!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A careless picnicker unleashes 2 monsters on the Downtown streets.

data.title: Plague of Frogs
data.text: Mythos Ability: Lore checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Will checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. Witches and Warlocks move like stalkers.

data.title: Plague of Insects
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators that end their turns in the street lose 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity. The terror level increases by 1.

data.title: Planetary Alignment
data.text: Mythos Ability: Thanks to the mystic energy generated by the planetary alignment, all Spells have a Sanity cost of 0.

data.title: Plans in Motion
data.text:
Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: At the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after this card enters play), roll a die. On a 1 or 2, add one uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track.
Pass: If the Feds Raid Innsmouth track is filled, resolve it, then return this card to the box.
Fail: If the Ancient One awakens, return this card to the box.

data.title: Police Helpless to Displace Vagrants
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Downtown streets may spend $5 or 2 Clue tokens to draw the top 3 cards of the Spell deck, choose 1 Spell to keep, and discard the rest.

data.title: Police Offer Reward for Information!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator may spend any number of his Clue tokens. For each Clue token he spends, he gains $2.

data.title: Police Proclaim Cult Crackdown
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Cultists in Arkham are returned to the cup.

name: Police Step Up Patrols in Northside!

data.title: Police Step Up Patrols in Northside!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Northside streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Private Security Hired in Uptown!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Uptown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Profane Relics Seized
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Place 1 Clue token on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it entered play).

data.title: Raining Cats and Dogs
data.text: Mythos Ability: Speed checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty, and players receive one less movement point during the Movement Phase. Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus. Return any Fire Vampires in play to the cup. If a Fire Vampire enters play, return it to the cup and draw a different monster.

data.title: Rare Antiquities Up for Auction!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player draws 1 Unique Item. He may purchase it for the list price. Each time a player chooses not to purchase it, the player to his left may purchase it, but the price goes up by $1. Once each player has had a chance to buy the item, if no one has purchased it, the item is discarded.

data.title: Rash of Graffiti
data.text: Mythos Ability: Skill checks to close or seal gates in Arkham are made at a -2 penalty.

name: Rash of Missing Persons!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Rash of Missing Persons!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player chooses an investigator to be lost in time and space

data.title: Relentless Doom
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, monster surges cause 1 doom token to be added to the Ancient One's doom track.

data.title: Restful Day!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators gain 1 Stamina.

data.title: Return to the Old Ways
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Place 1 Clue token on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase after the first. Any time a player attempts to use a Common Item, whether by applying its bonuses to combat, exhausting it, or discarding it, roll a die. On a 1 or 2, it falls apart before it can be used and must be discarded.

data.title: Ring Around the Moon
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each time an investigator in Arkham fails a Spell check, add a doom token to the doom track.

data.title: Riots
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 3 Stamina tokens per player on it. Any player may pay Stamina while in the Northside streets during the Arkham Encounters Phase to remove Stamina tokens from this card on a 1-for-1 basis.

name: Rituals of Power
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Rituals of Power
data.text: Mythos Ability: An arcane ritual increases the Stamina damage of all monsters by 1.

data.title: River Breaches the Levees
data.text: Mythos Ability: Place 1 Exhibit Item, facedown, in each of the Merchant District and Rivertown streets. The first investigator to reach one of these neighborhood streets may end his turn to take the item.

data.title: Rivertown Residents Take Back Streets!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Rivertown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: R'lyeh Rising
data.text: Mythos Ability: Star Spawn and Maniacs have their toughness increased by 1. The difficulty to seal or close gates to R'lyeh is increased by 1.

data.title: Sailor Take Warning
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, any investigator who enters an aquatic location must pass a Fight (-1) check or lose 2 Stamina.

data.title: Scholar Speaks of Leylines
data.text: Mythos Ability: Spells cost 1 additional Sanity to cast, but any investigator who successfully casts a Spell receives +1 Fight and +1 Will until the end of his turn.

name: School of Medicine Seeks Test Subjects!

data.title: School of Medicine Seeks Test Subjects!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator may choose to lose 2 Stamina to gain a Retainer.

data.title: Scientist Warns of Dimensional Rift!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Dimensional Shamblers and Hounds of Tindalos are returned to the cup. If one or more monster is returned to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

data.title: Scurrilous Stranger Scandal!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The investigators may collectively spend 5 Clue tokens. If they do so, the first player draws a Gate marker and claims it as a trophy.

name: Seven for a Secret, Never to be Told

data.title: Seven for a Secret, Never to be Told
data.text: Mythos Ability: During the Upkeep Phase, the first player rolls 2 dice. If the sum of the result is 7, each investigator wih no Clue tokens gains 1 Clue token and loses 1 Sanity.

data.title: Severe Hailstorm
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator in a street area at the end of the Mythos Phase must choose 1 item to discard.

name: Sheldon Gang Turns to Police for Aid!

data.title: Sheldon Gang Turns to Police for Aid!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The Sheldon Gang disturbs a burial mound, releasing 2 monsters into the Uptown Streets.

data.title: Shipwreck!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The boat's hold releases 2 monsters into the Innsmouth Shore streets.

data.title: Signs of Cult Activity!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The cultists performed a ritual that released 2 monsters into the Factory District streets.

data.title: Silver Twilight Lodge on Trial!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Anyone with a Silver Twilight Lodge Membership is arrested. All other investigators who have 1 or more Spells must discard a Spell or be arrested.

data.title: Slugs
data.text: Mythos Ability: Fight and Speed checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.

data.title: Snow Drifts
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who move into a street area must end their movement. They must still evade or combat any monsters in that area, however. Note that this only applies to street areas that an investigator moves into, not a street area in which he starts his Movement Phase.

data.title: Solar Eclipse
data.text: Mythos Ability: Due to the interference of the solar eclipse, no spells may be cast

data.title: Someone's Watching Me
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first investigator to close or seal a gate is Blessed. Discard this card afterwards.

data.title: Songs from the Woods
data.text: Mythos Ability: Goat Spawn, Tcho-tchos, and Dark Young have their toughness increased by 1.

data.title: Soothing Night!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators gain 1 Sanity.

data.title: Soup Kitchen Seeks Donations!
data.text: Mythos Ability: If a single investigator spends $3, every other investigator with no money gains 1 Stamina.

data.title: Southside Strangler Suspected!
data.text: Mythos Ability: However, the press is mistaken, and the murders were caused by 2 monsters that are released into the Southside streets.

data.title: Spawn of Yog-Sothoth
data.text: Mythos Ability: Cultists have Magical Immunity.  Additionally, any investigator who is lost in time and space must pass a Will (-1) check or be devoured.

data.title: Spiritualism Gains in Popularity
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators may not evade Undead monsters and receive -1 on Combat checks against Undead monsters.

data.title: Stalkers in the Night!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Star Vampires, Hunting Horrors, and Spectral Hunters in Arkham are returned to the cup.  If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

data.title: Startling Message Sent from Overseas!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Place 2 Clue tokens on the Newspaper. If the Kingsport Horror expansion game board is in play, place an additional 2 Clue tokens on the Wireless Station.

data.title: Stopped Clocks
data.text: Mythos Ability: During each phase of the game turn, players may choose the player order during that phase. (Note that the order of the phases remains unchanged.) If players cannot agree on an order, the first player chooses. At the end of the turn, the first player marker is passed to the left as usual.

name: Strange Creatures Seen on the Shore!

data.title: Strange Creatures Seen on the Shore!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster appears in each of the following: River Docks, Unvisited Isle, and all aquatic locations and all aquatic street areas on expansion game boards.

data.title: Strange Forces Exorcised from Arkham!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Until the end of next turn, any time an investigator draws 1 or more Spells for any reason, he draws 1 fewer card (to a minimum of 0). Leave this card in play to indicate this.

data.title: Strange Lights on Campus!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The Library, Administration Building and Science Building are all closed until the end of next turn.  Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

data.title: Strange Murders
data.text: Mythos Ability: Flying monsters have their toughness increased by 2 and gain Overwhelming 1.

data.title: Strange Ornithological Sightings
data.text: Mythos Ability: Draw monsters from the monster cup until you have drawn 2 flying monsters.  They are placed in the Sky. Flying monsters do not attack investigators with Exhibit Items before the end of next turn.  Leave this care in play until then to indicate this.

data.title: Strange Power Flux Plagues City!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators in Other World areas may immediately return to Arkham.

data.title: Strange Sightings!
data.text:
Mythos Ability: A monster surge occurs.  However, no gates open this turn.
The first player gains 1 Clue token.

data.title: Strange Sightings! (2)
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster surge occurs.  However, no gates open this turn.  The first player gains 1 Clue token.

name: Strange Sightings! (3)
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Strange Sightings! (3)
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster surge occurs.  However, no gates open this turn.  The first player gains 1 Clue token.

name: Strange Sightings! (4) x2
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Strange Sightings! (4)
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster surge occurs.  However, no gates open this turn.  The first player gains 1 Clue token.

data.title: Strange Sightings! (5)
data.text:
Mythos Ability: A monster surge occurs. However, no gates open this turn.
The first player gains 1 Clue token.

data.title: Strange Sightings! (6)
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster surge occurs.  However, no gates open this turn.  The first player gains 1 Clue token.

data.title: Strange Sightings! (7)
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster surge occurs.  However, no gates open this turn.  The first player gains 1 Clue token.

data.title: Strange Sleep Disorder Baffles Doctors!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators who have a Madness card (from the Dunwich Horror expansion) or whose Sanity is currently 2 or less must move immediately to the first area of the Dreamlands.

data.title: Strange Statue Destroyed!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Unfortunately, the statue's destruction lets 2 monsters loose in the Village Commons streets.

data.title: Strange Surprise!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster appears at the first player's location. If this is a stable location or an Other World area, the monster appears in the Outskirts instead.

data.title: Strange Tremors Cease!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Chthonians and Dholes in Arkham are returned to the cup.  If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

data.title: Strange Visions Cease!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player chooses one rift token on the rift track.  If that rift is active, turn the token facedown.  Otherwise, return it to the bank.

data.title: Strange Waves Subside!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player chooses one open gate and closes it, returning its gate token to the gate token pile.

name: Strange Whispers Promise Vengeance!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Strange Whispers Promise Vengeance!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A monster appears at a street location chosen by the first player.

data.title: Strange Woman Distributing Words
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player draws a Spell.

data.title: Strength of the Earth
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters with a moon dimensional symbol have their toughness, combat damage (if any), and horror damage (if any) increased by 1.

data.title: Students Protest Museum Exhibit
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator who ends his movement in the streets must make a Fight (-1) check or be delayed by the throngs of protestors.

data.title: Sunny and Clear
data.text: Mythos Ability: Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.

name: Superstitions Abound!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Superstitions Abound!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player chooses one investigator to become Blessed and another investigator to become Cursed.  (If there is only one investigator, nothing happens).

data.title: Surrounded by Mystery
data.text: Mythos Ability: Two Gates open this turn, but no doom tokens are added to the doom track.

data.title: Taxes Come Due!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All investigators discard one half of all their money (rounded down).

data.title: Temperence Fever Sweeps City
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator with Whiskey must pass a Sneak (-1) check or get arrested and taken to the Police Station.  If this occurs, they must discard their Whiskey.  In addition, Hibb's Roadhouse is closed until the end of next turn.  Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

data.title: Terror at the Train Station!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A rusty train arrives in Arkham, disgorging 2 monsters into the Northside streets.

data.title: The Ancient One's Servants!
data.text: Mythos Ability: If there are any Deep Ones or Cultists in play, add 1 doom token to the Ancient One's doom track.

data.title: The Chill of the Grave
data.text: Mythos Ability: All Undead monsters have their toughness increased by 1

data.title: The Doors of Sleep
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the Harborside streets gain 1 Clue token, then have an encounter during the Other Worlds Encounters Phase as though they were in the Dreamlands.

data.title: The Evil is Everywhere
data.text: Mythos Ability: Two Gates open this turn, but no doom tokens are added to the doom track.

data.title: The Festival
data.text: Mythos Ability: Cultists and Byakhees have their toughness increased by 1.

data.title: The Great Ritual
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Cultists, Witches, Warlocks, and High Priests have their toughness increased by 2 while this card is in play. Place 1 clue token on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it entered play).

data.title: The Innsmouth Plague
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: At the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after this card enters play), the first player draws one Innsmouth Look card.

data.title: The Key and the Gate (mythos)
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Each time a Gate opens, place a Clue token on this card.

data.title: The Man in Black
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators who end their movement in the French Hill streets may deal with the Man in Black to gain power.  They roll dice equal to their current Sanity and for every failed die, the lose 1 Sanity.  If this reduces them to 0 Sanity, they are devoured and the player must start a new character.  Otherwise, they gain 1 Clue token and draw 1 Spell.

data.title: The Next Act Begins!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The terror level is increased by 1.  However, no gate is opened this turn.

data.title: The Next Act Begins! (2)
data.text: Mythos Ability: The terror level is increased by 1.  However, no gate is opened this turn.

data.title: The Rails are Washed Out
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators cannot travel between cities using the Train Station or other depot locations while this card remains in play.

data.title: The Repairer of Reputations
data.text: Mythos Ability: Players who are Cursed, have an outstanding bank loan, possess a Detriment card, or are in jail may immediately discard the offending cards and/or may be immediately freed from jail.  Those who take advantage of this offer are reduced to 0 Sanity.

data.title: The Siren Call!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A strange feeling pulls the first player towards the sea, forcing him to draw two Innsmouth Look cards.

data.title: The Southside Strangler Strikes
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Return one Ally from the Ally deck to the box at random at the end of every Mythos Phase while this card is in play (beginning the turn after it entered play). The Southside Strangler has struck again!

data.title: The Stars Are Right
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Roll a die at the end of every Mythos Phase while this card is in play (beginning the turn after it enters play).  On a 1 or 2, place one doom token on the ancient one's doom track.

data.title: The Streets are Flooded
data.text: Mythos Ability: All street areas are also aquatic locations while this card remains in play.

data.title: The Tattered King
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Place 1 Clue token on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it enters play).

data.title: The Tempest
data.text: Mythos Ability: Luck checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty. Speed checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus, and investigators receive 1 extra movement point. All flying monsters in the Sky when this card enters play, or that move to the Sky while it remains in play, are returned to the monster cup.

data.title: The Terrible Experiment
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 5 monsters from the cup on it.  Any player may choose to fight one or more of these monsters while in the Miskatonic U. streets during the Arkham Encounter Phase.  If defeated, they are claimed as monster trophies. These monsters do not move, are not considered on the board, and do not count against the monster limit.

data.title: The Trembling Earth
data.text:
Mythos Ability: At the start of each Upkeep Phase while this card is in play, roll a die. On a 1, the terror level increases by 1.
While this card is in play, investigators receive 1 less movement point each turn.

data.title: The Unraveling Tapestry
data.text: Mythos Ability: Setup: Place 3 Clue tokens on this rumor.

data.title: The Veil is Strong
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, it takes one more open gate than usual to awaken the Ancient One.

data.title: The Veil is Weak
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, it takes one more sealed gate than usual to win the game.

data.title: Theater Experiences Renewal!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators in Arkham may immediately spend any amount of Sanity, up to the current terror level or the investigator's current Sanity, whichever is lower.  For each point of Sanity spent, the player gains 1 Clue token.

data.title: Things of Darkness
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ghouls, Formless Spawns, Shoggoths and Flying Polyps have their toughness increased by 1

data.title: Tidal Wave!
data.text: Mythos Ability: A crashing wave strikes the shore! All investigators in aquatic locations must pass a Fight (-1) check or lose 2 Stamina.

data.title: Time After Time
data.text: Mythos Ability: Hounds of Tindalos and Yithians have their toughness increased by 1.  Gates to Another Time have their difficulty to be closed or sealed increased by 2

data.title: To Conquer Death
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 3 Clue tokens on it. Each time an investigator passes a Horror check with 2 or more successes, add 1 Clue token to this card.

name: Tongue-Tied Teacher Taunted!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Tongue-Tied Teacher Taunted!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator with the most Clue tokens loses 1 Clue token.  Each investigator with the fewest Clue tokens gains 1 Clue token.

data.title: Tourists Flock to Arkham
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, investigators in a street area receive -1 on all Combat checks and gain 1 Sanity each time they pass a Combat check.

data.title: Town Welcomes Visitors
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player chooses a dimensional symbol. Draw new monsters from the monster cup to replace each monster with that dimensional symbol in Arkham. (Ignore monsters in the Sky, but not the Outskirts.) Return monsters so replaced to the cup after all new monsters have been drawn.

data.title: Train Robbers Strike Again!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Any investigator currently in the Train Station or a depot location an an expansion game board must discard 2 items, if able.

data.title: Traveller Lost in Fog!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player must immediately move to the  Strange High House in the Mist.

data.title: Two Sunsets
data.text: Mythos Ability: Sneak and Will checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty

data.title: Unending Darkness
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Place 10 Clue tokens on this card. When a monster moves from a street area or a location to the Sky or into a vortex (either on the Dunwich Horror or Innsmouth Horror expansion game boards), remove 1 Clue token from this card.

data.title: Unpleasant Surprise!
data.text: Mythos Ability: If the terror level is 8 or higher, or there is only one empty space left on the Ancient One's doom track, then the Ancient One immediately awakens.

data.title: Unusual Moonrises
data.text: Mythos Ability: Sneak and Lore checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.  Will checks in Arkham are made at a -2 penalty.

data.title: Unusual Phenomenon Sighted in Arkham!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player must choose one inactive rift (if there are any).  That rift's track immediately fills up and the rift opens.

data.title: Uptown Hosts Famous Publisher
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators in Arkham may immediately make a Will (-1) check.  Any who pass may pay $3 to draw Spells as if they were receiving Magic Lessons at Ye Olde Magick Shoppe

data.title: Vigilante Guards the Night!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Downtown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Virulent Disease
data.text: Mythos Ability: Ongoing Effect: Place 1 Clue token on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it enters play.  If a player ends his movement at St. Mary's Hospital, he may place a doom token on his investigator sheet.

name: Vivisection Victim!
expansion: The Black Goat of the Woods

data.title: Vivisection Victim!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The first player may choose a monster in Arkham and move it to the Science Building.

data.title: Weakened Forces
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, all Magical Weapons have any bonuses they provide to Combat checks reduced by 1.

data.title: Whateley Family Feud Escalates!
data.text: Mythos Ability: All monsters in the Backwoods Country streets or locations are returned to the cup.

data.title: Whateleys Accused of Witchcraft!
data.text: Mythos Ability: The accusations come after someone (or something) releases 2 monsters into the Backwoods Country streets.

data.title: Whippoorwills of Dunwich
data.text: Mythos Ability: If an investigator is reduced to 0 Stamina or Sanity while this card is in play, roll a die.  On a 1, the investigator is devoured as the whippoorwills catch his soul, and the terror level is increased by 1.

data.title: Wildfire
data.text: Mythos Ability: Each investigator in the Black Cave or Woods at the end of the Mythos Phase, as well as each investigator in Bishop's Brook Bridge, Cold Spring Glen, or Wizard's Hill on the Dunwich Horror expansion game board at the end of the Mythos Phase, loses 1 Stamina.

data.title: Wild Visions Plague City!
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators may set their skill sliders however they want when this card is drawn.

data.title: Windy
data.text: Mythos Ability: Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.  Speed checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus, and investigators receive 1 extra movement point.  The Sky is considered to be adjacent to all unstable locations as well as all street areas.

data.title: Witch Burning Anniversary!
data.text: Mythos Ability: An ancient curse strikes Arkham, releasing 2 monsters into the Rivertown streets.

data.title: Wolfsbane in Bloom
data.text: Mythos Ability: Monsters with Magical Immunity are treated as having Magical Resistance instead and have their toughness increased by 1.

data.title: World Torn Asunder
data.text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place 1 Clue token on it.  Any player may discard a Blessing and a Skill while in the Miskatonic U. streets during the Arkham Encounter Phase to remove all Clue tokens from this card.

data.title: Worlds Drifting Apart
data.text: Mythos Ability: While this card is in play, no rift tokens may be placed on the Rift track.

data.title: Yuggoth in Retrograde
data.text: Mythos Ability: Investigators receive +1 to Fight and Lore checks to close Gates.
